intro: Ruellia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white, which bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Ruellia grandiflora is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
